intro: Crepis gillii var. erysimoides, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy, basal leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Its small, yellowish flowers bloom in early summer, and the plant is often found in meadows and grasslands at high elevations. It is a hardy species adapted to cold climates and is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
